titles: The Plow-man's complaint, the free-houlders proposition, and the high-shooes resolution.
place: From the heart of England [i.e. London] :
date: the first of March, commonly called St. Taffies-Day, 1678 [i.e. 1679]
notes: Actual place and date of publication from Wing.
Verse: "Shall we stand tamely mute, and see our England sunk ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Popish Plot, 1678 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
